findings.title: Incompatibility with Deflationary/Rebasing Tokens
findings.description: The SubscriptionPool contract is incompatible with deflationary/rebasing tokens due to its asset-transferring routines not checking for accurate book-keeping amounts after transfer.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `approve()` routine may have idiosyncrasies from current widely-used token contracts that do not strictly follow the ERC-20 specification or have additional functionalities beyond the specification, which can cause unexpected balance inconsistencies when comparing internal asset records with external ERC20 token contracts.

findings.title: Suggested Event Generation for Key Operations
findings.description: In Ethereum, events are used to record runtime dynamics and are accessible to external analytics and reporting tools. However, several key operations lack meaningful events to reflect their changes.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the PinkSale SubscriptionPool implementation, there is a privileged governance account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol-wide operations.
